intro: Phymaspermum scoparium, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It is well adapted to drought conditions, with deep roots that allow it to access water from deeper soil layers. Phymaspermum scoparium is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
